title: American_Top_40_1975_February_22nd
description:
"And the countdown rolls on."


American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This recording is a rebroadcast from internet radio.

There is a song in this countdown (by an American artist) that was sent to Casey several years prior by a New Zealander asking Casey to play it then. Casey wrote back saying he couldnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t play it because it hadn't made the countdown. Now Casey plays a portion of the original.

The Jackson 5 has their 16th hit record in a row with "I Am Love (Part 2)" at number 34.

Casey plays a montage of hits by Neil Sedaka (because he is at number 33 with "Laughter In The Rain"), who already had a successful chart career in the late 50s and early 60s before British artists covered the American charts with a different sound.

The artist, who has had more hit records than any other in the rock era, has his 58th song in the countdown.

Casey tells about Tommy James, an artist who was able to hit the charts from 1966 to 1969 with songs in the styles of bubble-gum music, psychedelic rock, social-commentary records, and good old basic rock and roll.
